meanings.definition: A small, fast Spanish or Portuguese sailing ship of the 15th-17th centuries.
meanings.sent1: The caravelle sailed swiftly across the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Explorers used the caravelle to navigate the seas.
meanings.sent3: The caravelle and its crew braved stormy waters.
meanings.sent4: The caravelle was a symbol of exploration and adventure.
meanings.sent5: The caravelle's design revolutionized maritime travel.

meanings.definition: A type of French dessert made with layers of sponge cake and chocolate or coffee buttercream.
meanings.sent1: The caravelle dessert was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent2: I indulged in a delicious caravelle after dinner.
meanings.sent3: The caravelle dessert melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The caravelle dessert was a sweet masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The caravelle dessert looked too beautiful to eat.

meanings.definition: A type of Swiss watch brand known for its luxury timepieces.
meanings.sent1: She admired the elegant caravelle on his wrist.
meanings.sent2: The caravelle watch gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: His caravelle watch was a timeless accessory.
meanings.sent4: The caravelle watch symbolized sophistication and style.
meanings.sent5: The caravelle watch was a prized possession.
